014package org.microbean.event;
015
016import java.lang.System.Logger;
017
018import java.util.List;
019import java.util.Set;
020
021import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
022import javax.lang.model.element.Modifier;
023import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
024
025import javax.lang.model.type.ArrayType;
026import javax.lang.model.type.DeclaredType;
027import javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind;
028import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
029import javax.lang.model.type.TypeVariable;
030
031import org.microbean.assign.Types;
032
033import org.microbean.construct.Domain;
034
035import static java.lang.System.Logger.Level.WARNING;
036
037/**
038 * A utility for working with <dfn>event types</dfn>.
039 *
040 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
041 *
042 * @see #eventTypes(TypeMirror)
043 *
044 * @see #legalEventType(TypeMirror)
045 */
046public final class EventTypes extends Types {
047
048
049  /*
050   * Static fields.
051   */
052
053
054  private static final Logger LOGGER = System.getLogger(EventTypes.class.getName());
055
056
057  /*
058   * Constructors.
059   */
060
061
062  /**
063   * Creates a new {@link EventTypes}.
064   *
065   * @param domain a {@link Domain}; must not be {@code null}
066   *
067   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code domain} is {@code null}
068   */
069  public EventTypes(final Domain domain) {
070    super(domain);
071  }
072
073
074  /*
075   * Instance methods.
076   */
077
078
079  /**
080   * Returns an immutable {@link List} of {@linkplain #legalEventType(TypeMirror) legal event types} that the supplied
081   * {@link TypeMirror} bears.
082   *
083   * <p>The returned {@link List} may be empty.</p>
084   *
085   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
086   *
087   * @return an immutable {@link List} of {@linkplain #legalEventType(TypeMirror) legal event types} that the supplied
088   * {@link TypeMirror} bears; never {@code null}
089   *
090   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
091   *
092   * @microbean.nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
093   *
094   * @microbean.idempotency This method is idempotent and returns determinate values.
095   *
096   * @microbean.threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
097   */
098  public final List<? extends TypeMirror> eventTypes(final TypeMirror t) {
099    // https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#event_types_and_qualifier_types
100    if (t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED) {
101      final Element e = ((DeclaredType)t).asElement();
102      if (e.getKind().isInterface() || !e.getKind().isClass() || e.getModifiers().contains(Modifier.ABSTRACT)) {
103        // "An event object is an instance of a concrete Java class...."
104        if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
105          LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " is an illegal event type");
106        }
107        return List.of();
108      }
109    }
110    // "The event types of the event include all superclasses and interfaces of the [concrete] runtime class of the
111    // event object."
112    return this.supertypes(t, EventTypes::legalEventType);
113  }
114
115
116  /*
117   * Static methods.
118   */
119
120
121  /**
122   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link TypeMirror} is a <dfn>legal event type</dfn>.
123   *
124   * <p>Legal event types are, exactly:</p>
125   *
126   * <ol>
127   *
128   * <li>{@linkplain TypeKind#ARRAY Array} types whose {@linkplain ArrayType#getComponentType() component type}s are
129   * legal event types</li>
130   *
131   * <li>{@linkplain TypeKind#DECLARED Declared} types that contain no {@linkplain TypeKind#WILDCARD wildcard type}s for
132   * every level of containment</li>
133   *
134   * </ol>
135   *
136   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
137   *
138   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is a legal bean type; {@code false} otherwise
139   *
140   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
141   *
142   * @microbean.idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
143   *
144   * @microbean.threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but {@link TypeMirror}
145   * implementations and {@link Domain} implementations may not be safe for such use.
146   */
147  public static final boolean legalEventType(final TypeMirror t) {
148    // https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#event_types_and_qualifier_types
149    return switch (t.getKind()) {
150    case ARRAY -> {
151      // Recurse into the component type.
152      if (!legalEventType(((ArrayType)t).getComponentType())) { // note recursion
153        if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
154          LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " has a component type that is an illegal event type (" + ((ArrayType)t).getComponentType());
155        }
156        yield false;
157      }
158      yield true;
159    }
160
161    // You can't fire a primitive event as of this writing, but there's nothing stopping a primitive event type from
162    // being legal otherwise.
163    // case BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT -> true;
164
165    case DECLARED -> {
166      // "An event type may not contain an unresolvable type variable. A wildcard type is not considered an unresolvable
167      // type variable."
168      //
169      // We interpret "contain" to mean "have as a type argument, recursively, anywhere".
170      for (final TypeMirror ta : ((DeclaredType)t).getTypeArguments()) {
171        if (ta.getKind() != TypeKind.WILDCARD && !legalEventType(ta)) { // note recursion
172          if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
173            LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " has a type argument that is an illegal event type (" + ta + ")");
174          }
175          yield false;
176        }
177      }
178      yield true;
179    }
180
181    default -> {
182      if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
183        LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " is an illegal event type");
184      }
185      yield false;
186    }
187    };
188
189  }
190
191  /**
192   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link TypeMirror} is a <dfn>legal observed event type</dfn>.
193   *
194   * <p>A legal observed event type is <a
195   * href="https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#event_types_and_qualifier_types">any Java type
196   * that a method parameter may bear</a>.
197   *
198   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
199   *
200   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is a legal observed event type; {@code false} otherwise
201   *
202   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
203   *
204   * @microbean.idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
205   *
206   * @microbean.threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but {@link TypeMirror}
207   * implementations and {@link Domain} implementations may not be safe for such use.
208   */
209  public static final boolean legalObservedEventType(final TypeMirror t) {
210    // https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#event_types_and_qualifier_types
211    // "Any Java type [that a method parameter element may bear] may be an observed event type."
212    return switch (t.getKind()) {
213    case ARRAY, BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DECLARED, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT, TYPEVAR -> true;
214    default -> false;
215    };
216  }
217
218}
